N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.15 - Executive Order No. 15: Designating the Department of Social Services as State Agencies responsible for programs under Title XX of the Federal Social Security Act

State Regulations

By virtue of the authority vested in me as Governor of the

State of New York, and in order that social services be provided to individuals
and families in need thereof and eligible therefor in this State, I, Hugh L. Carey, do hereby designate the Department of Social Services as the State
agency responsible for the supervision of the administration of this State's
program for the provision of services under Title XX of the Federal Social

Security Act. The responsibilities of the Department under this
designation include the following: (1)

The Department shall publish and make generally available to the public each
year a proposed comprehensive annual services plan, as prepared by it and
approved by me, setting forth the State's plan for the provision of social
services for the State's services program year. (2)

The Department shall also publish a final
comprehensive annual services program plan meeting my approval. (3)

The Department shall also be responsible
for submission of the State Plan required by Title XX, for the negotiations
that may be necessary relative to the approval of such State Plan, for the
promulgation of regulations and for assuring that the State meets the
requirements of Title XX. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: September 24, 1975
